track.name: Animals
comments: "Literally the only good song on The 2nd Flop." I laughed pretty hard at this :D I'm not sure if I agree though. The guitar is really nice but the lyrics are dreadful, plus it goes down really badly live. Probably because they play it after Knights (WTF).
lovely
stunning
прекрасно
I loved the whole album, but I was left amazed by the OoS-esque turn they took with this song. It's glorious! : O
awesome tunes... <3
This is the best song of the album [9]
Kill yourselves, do us all a favour. Yes please. Fucking business ghouls.
Belíssima!
Bend more rules, and buy yourself an island...
It's got all the rage of a Rage Against the Machine tune, the baroque pop lushness and of course... damn any song that asks the uber rich and powerful to kill themselves...
Literally the only good song on The 2nd Flop.
I am falling in love with this song. Repeat it all over fo so many times. The tunes are so fantastic!
Very oldschool, gorgeous Muse sound.
This is the best song of the album [7]

"Certain guitar parts throughout this song sound similar to Pink Floyd's 'Shine On Your Crazy Diamond'" - though I did not think of any particular song, some guitar parts also remind me of Pink Floyd. Makes it even greater!
Bought the album, enjoyed it but once I heard ANIMALS I was WOW, it's on repeat now.
This is Muse again track. :) I stopped listening to Muse after Black Holes, but maybe I should remember my CD's

am I the only one here that thinks totally the opposite? I'm a big pre-BH&R era supporter compared to what came after it, but in no way I see this as the best song in the album. actually quite the opposite, I skip it every time because of how boring it sounds to me.
1:20 ~ 1:34  greatest moment on record
